title: Dimitri94
author: Dimitri94
created_time: May 16, 2023, 12:56:20 PMLast edit: May 16, 2023, 02:40:18 PM by Dimitri94
content: Work Progress: https://ibb.co/VvJZWBL   https://ibb.co/VTn5hj0     https://ibb.co/8mg8ZPrSatoshi Nakamoto, you are one of the pioneers in the welfare of modern human life. Bitcoiners are ever grateful to your discovery. None of us know whether you are dead or alive. Many people have tried to find you but no one specifically recognized you. But your identity is not important to me because you are not of any particular race, you belong to everyone in the world. I would like to emphasize your discovery rather than your identity. If I could I would dedicate America's Statue of Liberty to you which is hidden inside my mind. But today in this regard i tried to do through my artwork. The people of the world never thought they would have freedom in financial transactions or services. The freedom you give us. People were imprisoned by the conventional banking system and would have been held hostage to a third party. Today you are the guide of liberation from that situation.When people are desperate to save wealth always had to worry about the lack of security at that moment you have shown them an alternative way. Now wherever people move with their wealth virtually.Today about 15 percent of women in the world have also found their economic independence. While many of us may not appreciate you today, the guy who bought pizza with 10000 bitcoins will understand your invention better than anyone else. Many have now learned to guess to what extent your discoveries may rise in the future.A historic and venerable symbol of American independence is the Statue of Liberty, a gift from France to America. But in reality, I have nothing to give you. I express my gratitude to you from the core of my heart.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: The founder of bitcoin and popularly known as Satoshi Nakamoto is not dead. He is only anonymous in real life and also in the forum. I strongly believe that Satoshi Nakamoto is in this forum because he can not create this wonderful asset to help humanity and also create the platform to discuss about the asset and one person will come and tell me he is not here. It is not possible. The financial freedom from bitcoin is awesome, Satoshi Nakamoto just disappointd all the government plans to suffer the massive graduates in the world. Today with bitcoin, graduates have no time for Federal Government works again.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: I like the image you've made. To me, it's sort of a mix of the Statue of Liberty and Themis (the goddess of justice). The latter comes to mind because her eyes seem closed, and closed eyes symbolize impartiality of justice. Just as liberty is relevant because of the financial freedom that Bitcoin provides, justice with closed eyes is relevant because Bitcoin is pseudonymous and decentralized, and as a result people can use it without fearing biased treatment.I also agree with the op's sentiment that Satoshi's identity isn't important, and we should focus on the gift of Bitcoin instead.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Bitcoin is only a facility, the final decision rests with the user's choice whether they are happy with the free way or regulated. And it seems that more bitcoin "users" have never transacted freely because they do so in a centralized application environment, even reducing the level of interest in using bitcoin if you see the phenomenon of increasing network fees lately.People are really finding it difficult to migrate from some of the conventional systems.

comments.body: We all have to agree that his knowledge and innovation paved a path for other people to acquire not only wealth but so many opportunities that will only come by if you are at the top of the economic hierarchy. Aside from being grateful, we all knew that he also received a lot of contempt from authorities since what he has made ignited the thought of the authorities that maybe he is creating something so that people will be more convinced to rebel from their authorities.
